SWN.roll.appearing.dungeon: Number appearing in a dungeon when wandering.
SWN.details.name: Name
SWN.details.treasureTableHint: Drop a rollable table here to roll the monster treasure
SWN.details.instinctTableHint: Drop a rollable table here to roll an Instinctive Action
SWN.LanguagesHint: Enter a list of languages, separated by commas.
SWN.Setting.RerollInitiativeHint: Keep, reset, or reroll initiative each round.
SWN.Setting.MoraleHint: Morale Rating shown on monster sheets.
SWN.Setting.showMovementHint: Show Turn and Overland movement rates.
SWN.Setting.SignificantTreasureHint: Weight at which treasure will reduce the movement, only useful for basic encumbrance
SWN.Setting.psychicSkillsHint: Include the psychic skills from Stars Without Number
SWN.items.ShockAC: The AC value under which the weapon inflicts Shock damage. Leave blank for Foci that inflict Shock regardless.
SWN.items.SkillDamageLong: Add skill level to weapon damage and Shock.
SWN.items.typeTag: Type a comma separated list of tags: 'Melee,R,2H,Missile (10’ / 20’ / 30’)' and press ENTER
SWN.items.CurrencyHint: Use SWN coin standards or the full B/X standard.
SWN.items.desc.SR: Slow Reload. It takes a Main Action to reload this weapon.
SWN.items.desc.2H: Two Handed. The weapon requires two hands to use in combat. Ranged two-handed weapons cannot be fired effectively while an enemy is within melee range.
SWN.items.desc.AP: Armor Piercing. This weapon ignores non-magical hides, armor and shields for purposes of its hit rolls.
SWN.items.desc.FX: Fixed. The weapon is too heavy and clumsy to use without a fixed position and at least five minutes to entrench it.
SWN.items.desc.L: Long. The weapon is unusually long, allowing melee attacks to be made at targets up to 10 feet distant, even if an ally is in the way. Even so, the wielder still needs to be adjacent to a foe to count as being in melee with them for the puposes of forcing Fighting Withdrawals, disrupting large ranged weapons, or similar maneuvers.
SWN.items.desc.R: Reload. The weapon takes a Move action to reload. If the user has at least Shoot-1 skill, they can reload as an On Turn action instead.
SWN.items.desc.LL: Less Lethal. Foes brought to zero hit points by this weapon can always be left alive at the wielder's discretion.
SWN.items.desc.N: Numerous. Five of these count as only one Readied item.
SWN.items.desc.PM: Precisely Murderous. When used for an Execution Attack, the wapon applies an additional -1 penalty to the Physical save and does double damage even if it succeeds.
SWN.items.desc.S: Subtle. Can be easily hidden in ordinary clothing or concealed in jewelry.
SWN.items.desc.SS: Single Shot. This weapon takes ten rounds to reload, and the reloading effort is spoiled if an enemy melees the wielder.
SWN.items.desc.T: Throwable. While the waepon can be used in melee, it may be thrown out to the listed range as well, albeit it does no Shock in that case. Throwing a weapon while a foe is in melee range applies a -4 penalty to the attack roll.
SWN.spells.TimeHint: Length of time effort is committed
SWN.skills.desc.administer: Keep an organization running smoothly, scribe things well, plan out logistics, identify incompetent or treacherous workers, analyze records or archives, or otherwise do things that an executive or middle-manager would need to do.
SWN.skills.desc.connect: Find or know people who are useful to your purposes, make friendships or social acquaintances, know who to talk to to get favors or services, and call on the help or resources of organizations you belong to. Connect covers your PC’s ability to find the people you need, though convincing them to help may require more than this.
SWN.skills.desc.exert: Run, swim, climb, jump, labor for long periods, throw things, or otherwise exert your physical strength, stamina, and coordination. Even a PC with poor physical attributes might have a good Exert skill reflecting athletic training and expertise in making the most of their available talents.
SWN.skills.desc.heal: Treat wounds, cure diseases, neutralize poisons, diagnswn psychological health issues, and otherwise tend to the wounds of body and mind. The Heal skill cannot cure lost hit points directly, but it’s a vital skill in stabilizing Mortally Wounded allies or ensuring clean recovery from grievous injuries.
SWN.skills.desc.know: Know matters of history, geography, natural science, zoology, and other academic fields appropriate to a sage or scholar. While some sages might specialize in particular fields, most learned men and women in this age have a broad range of understanding, and will rarely be unable to even attempt to answer a question relevant to this skill.
SWN.skills.desc.lead: Inspire others to follow your lead and believe in your plans and goals. Manage subordinates and keep them focused, loyal, and motivated in the face of danger or failure. A successful leader will keep their subordinate’s faith and confidence even when reason might make the leader’s plan appear questionable at best.
SWN.skills.desc.magic: Cast or analyze magic and know things about famous mages or notable magical events. Classes that can’t cast spells obtain only intellectual and scholarly benefits from this skill.
SWN.skills.desc.notice: Notice small details, impending ambushes, hidden features, or concealed objects. Detect subtle smells, sounds, or other sensory input. Notice cannot be used simply to detect a lie, but keen attention can often discern a subject’s emotional state.
SWN.skills.desc.perform: Sing, act, dance, orate, or otherwise perform impressively for an audience. Compswn music, plays, writings, or other works of performance art. Most performers will have a particular field they excel at, though polymaths might exist if the PC’s background is appropriate for such versatility.
SWN.skills.desc.punch: Fight unarmed or with natural body weaponry. Punch, kick, grapple, or otherwise brawl without the benefit of man-made tools. This mode of fighting is inefficient at best without some special Focus to improve it, but it’s reliably non-lethal.
SWN.skills.desc.shoot: Fire a bow or crossbow or throw a hurled weapon. Maintain ranged weaponry and fletch arrows.
SWN.skills.desc.sneak: Move silently, hide in shadows, avoid notice, pick pockets, disguise yourself, pick locks, defeat traps, or otherwise overcome security measures.
SWN.skills.desc.stab: Fight with melee weapons or throw a hurled weapon. Maintain and identify weaponry.
SWN.skills.desc.survive: Hunt, fish, navigate by the stars, mitigate environmental hazards, identify plants and wildlife, and craft basic survival tools and shelter. A PC’s Survive skill is most pertinent to the environments in their background, but the basic principles can be applied in all but the most alien environments.
SWN.skills.desc.trade: Buy and sell at a profit, identify the worth of goods or treasures, deal with merchants and traders, find black-market goods and services, and know laws regarding smuggling and contraband.
SWN.skills.desc.work: This skill is a catch-all for any profession that might not otherwise merit its own skill, such as a painter, lawyer, farmer, or herdsman. The precise skill it represents will vary with the PC’s background.
SWN.skills.desc.biopsionics: Master powers of physical repair, body augmentation, and shapeshifting.
SWN.skills.desc.metapsionics: Master powers that nullify, boost, and shape the use of other psychic abilities.
SWN.skills.desc.precognition: Master the ability to sense future events and control probability.
SWN.skills.desc.telekinesis: Master the remote control of kinetic energy to move objects and fabricate force constructs.
SWN.skills.desc.telepathy: Master the reading and influencing of other sapient minds.
SWN.skills.desc.teleportation: Master the arts of physical translocation of yourself and allies.
SWN.reaction.Hostile: {name} is as aggressively hostile as the situation allows.
SWN.reaction.Unfriendly: {name} is more unfriendly and hostile than they'd be expected to be in the given situation.
SWN.reaction.Neutral: {name} is as predictably hostile or friendly as they'd usually be in this situation.
SWN.reaction.Indifferent: {name} is more friendly and benign than you'd expect them to be, given the circumstances.
SWN.reaction.Friendly: {name} is as friendly and helpful as their nature and the situation permits them to be.
